candidateProvision.title: Total Small Business Set-Asides
candidateProvision.applicationToScenario: This provision applies as the procurement value is between the micro-purchase and simplified acquisition thresholds, requiring a set-aside for small businesses. With five small businesses capable of providing the equipment, this ensures compliance with small business utilization.

matchedKeyProvision.title: Total Small Business Set-Asides
matchedKeyProvision.applicationToScenario: With an estimated value of $145,000, this procurement exceeds the micro-purchase threshold but is below the simplified acquisition threshold. Since market research indicates at least five capable small businesses, this procurement must be set aside exclusively for small businesses, especially given the agency's previous non-compliance with small business utilization requirements.

candidateProvision.title: Sustainable Acquisition Policy
candidateProvision.applicationToScenario: The agency's sustainability initiative aligns with this provision, requiring that 95% of new contract actions include energy-efficient products. The purchase of ENERGY STAR certified computers and printers complies with this requirement.

matchedKeyProvision.title: Sustainable Acquisition Policy
matchedKeyProvision.applicationToScenario: The agency's sustainability initiative aligns with this provision requiring federal agencies to advance sustainable acquisition. The computers and printers must be ENERGY STAR certified, meeting the requirement that products be energy-efficient. This provision mandates that 95% of new contract actions require products with specific environmental attributes.

candidateProvision.title: Effect of Listing
candidateProvision.applicationToScenario: This provision prohibits awarding contracts to debarred or proposed debarment contractors. Two potential suppliers are on the debarment list, so they must be excluded from consideration unless a compelling reason is documented.

matchedKeyProvision.title: Effect of Listing
matchedKeyProvision.applicationToScenario: Two potential suppliers are proposed for debarment. This provision prohibits soliciting offers from or awarding contracts to debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment contractors unless there's a compelling reason determined by the agency head. These suppliers must be excluded from consideration in the office equipment purchase.

candidateIssue.issueDescription: Lack of formal supplier qualification process.
candidateIssue.correctiveAction: Implement a documented supplier qualification process to ensure all suppliers meet quality standards. This includes verifying certifications and checking against exclusion lists to comply with FDA purchasing controls.

Establish written documentation for quality requirements communicated to suppliers. This ensures compliance with document control regulations and prevents misunderstandings that could lead to non-compliant products.

candidateIssue.issueDescription: Undisclosed conflict of interest in supplier relationship.
candidateIssue.correctiveAction: Develop a conflict of interest policy requiring disclosure of personal relationships with suppliers. This will prevent potential bias in supplier selection and ensure compliance with anti-kickback regulations.

candidateScenario.correctAction: Do not proceed with the supplier until their certification is verified in the industry database. Ensure compliance with supplier qualification regulations by requiring updated and verifiable certification documentation.

keyScenario.correctAction: Do not proceed with this supplier until proper verification of certifications is completed. Request on-site audit or third-party certification verification. Implement a formal supplier qualification process that includes verification of all certifications through official databases. Consider alternative suppliers with verified certifications even if costs are higher to ensure regulatory compliance.

candidateScenario.correctAction: Require detailed supply chain documentation to verify conflict-free sourcing. This ensures compliance with SEC reporting requirements for conflict minerals and avoids potential legal and reputational risks.

keyScenario.correctAction: Delay purchase until supplier provides detailed documentation of their supply chain. Request a Conflict Minerals Reporting Template (CMRT) from the supplier. Implement a conflict minerals due diligence program that includes supplier verification. Consider engaging a third-party auditor to verify supplier claims. Ensure compliance with SEC reporting requirements for conflict minerals.

candidateScenario.correctAction: Request updated SDS in the GHS format before purchasing. Ensure compliance with hazardous materials regulations by verifying that all documentation is current and meets regulatory standards.

keyScenario.correctAction: Do not purchase materials with outdated SDS. Request current GHS-compliant SDS from the supplier. If supplier cannot provide updated documentation, seek alternative suppliers. Implement a procedure to verify SDS compliance before purchasing hazardous materials. Ensure all hazardous materials have current SDS documentation that meets GHS requirements.

candidateScenario.correctAction: Consider the qualified small business to meet subcontracting goals. This aligns with federal contract requirements for small business utilization and supports compliance with subcontracting regulations.

keyScenario.correctAction: Award the subcontract to the qualified small business to meet federal contract small business subcontracting goals. Develop a mentor-protégé relationship between your company and the small business to address experience concerns. Document the selection process and small business utilization in your subcontracting plan. Provide appropriate support to ensure successful performance by the small business.
